intro: Eriocaulon seticuspe, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
